title_en: GRC-Net: Gram Residual Co-attention Net for epilepsy prediction
title_zh: GRC-Net：用于癫痫预测的格拉姆残差协同注意力网络
summary_en: Prediction of epilepsy based on electroencephalogram (EEG) signals is a rapidly evolving field. Previous studies have traditionally applied 1D processing to the entire EEG signal. However, we have adopted the Gram Matrix method to transform the signals into a 3D representation, enabling modeling of signal relationships across dimensions while preserving the temporal dependencies of the one-dimensional signals. Additionally, we observed an imbalance between local and global signals within the EEG data. Therefore, we introduced multi-level feature extraction, utilizing coattention for capturing global signal characteristics and an inception structure for processing local signals, achieving multi-granular feature extraction. Our experiments on the BONN dataset demonstrate that for the most challenging five-class classification task, GRC-Net achieved an accuracy of 93.66%, outperforming existing methods.
summary_zh: 基于脑电图（EEG）信号的癫痫预测是一个快速发展的领域。以往的研究通常对整个EEG信号进行一维处理。然而，我们采用格拉姆矩阵方法将信号转换为三维表示，从而能够在保留一维信号时间依赖性的同时，对跨维度的信号关系进行建模。此外，我们观察到EEG数据中局部信号与全局信号之间存在不平衡性。因此，我们引入了多层次特征提取方法，利用协同注意力机制捕捉全局信号特征，并采用Inception结构处理局部信号，实现了多粒度特征提取。我们在BONN数据集上的实验表明，对于最具挑战性的五分类任务，GRC-Net达到了93.66%的准确率，优于现有方法。
